Early Access Review
								I so wanted to love this game as I was a big fan of Pilot Wings on the N64!I suggest the developers should find and play it for inspiration, it was very similar.I would love to the features from that game, including the powered hang glider.I was totally disappointed though with this game because of the control method.The human head and neck is not designed to control and steer games. I dont know if I am spoiled because I have a VIVE and not a Rift, but it seems to be the RIFT's fault there are so many like this. Its rubbish. We dont ever do it in real life (control where we are going with our heads) and if you want to look at all that lovely scenery they have have made, you probably crash! I was trying to imagine if we drove our cars like that, OMG!Controllers, any, Vive or Xbox or anything please developers! I want to lie on the floor, arms outstretched holding on to the bar (that seems miles away to me in my headset) in front of me, pushing and pulling and tilting. Far Cry's hang glider feels more real to me than this because of the controls.The game has potential, but I am getting a refund right now in case they dont change the head steering method. Will buy again if control methods change though, as then I see it working well.

Some rings are worth more than others... why? Cuz. The motion controls, moving your head to turn, dive and climb... AWFUL! Who thought that up? A game that may require quick manuvering and as much control as possible... LETS STRAP A 2 POUND DEVICE TO THE FRONT OF THEIR FACES AND THEN HAVE THEM MOVE THEIR HEAD AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE, AS WILDLY AS POSSIBLE TO FLY A HORRIBLY UNWEILDY AIRCRAFT! BRILLIANT!I hope that person got a raise. MY NECK IS KILLING ME! Getting an ice pack, some bio-freeze and a refund. VR shouldn't hurt.
